body_html:
In Linux, I found the solution was that the config script looks in "/usr/local/cuda"
but the files were in /usr/local/cuda-8.0 (The version I just installed).

Perhaps something could be added to the config script that incorporates the idea that new cuda versions might have default installations at places like "/usr/local/cuda-*"

Heck, I would even take a side note in the script, "The default tensorflow location for cuda might vary from what ever the hack NVIDIA is doing now"

body:
In Linux, I found the solution was that the config script looks in "/usr/local/cuda"
but the files were in /usr/local/cuda-8.0 (The version I just installed). 

Perhaps something could be added to the config script that incorporates the idea that new cuda versions might have default installations at places like "/usr/local/cuda-*" 

Heck, I would even take a side note in the script, "The default tensorflow location for cuda might vary from what ever the hack NVIDIA is doing now"
